article:
In genealogy and in phylogenetic studies of evolutionary biology, 'antecedents'
or 'antecessors' are predecessors in a family line. For example, one is the
descendant of their grandparents, who are one's antecedents. This term has
particular utility in evolutionary coalescent theory, which models the process
of genetic drift in reverse time. {{Citation
 | last=Harding first=Rosalind, M. chapter=New phylogenies: an introductory look
 | at the coalescent. year=1998 title=New uses for new phylogenies
 | publisher=Oxford University Press publication-date=1998 isbn=0-19-854984-9
 | editor-last=Nee editor-first=S
 }}

The antonym of antecedent is [[Lineal descendant|descendant]].
